present persistent upper ﬂoral bracts in contrast with the rest.
The presence of cup-shaped glandular trichomes and long
patent eglandular trichomes can separate it from
exhibit diﬀerent type of leaves, the second lacking sessile glands.
especially its delta-shaped leaves and red ﬂowers, which
clearly diﬀerentiates it from the other sages. The raw herbal
material from all these taxa is frequently dried and cut
before marketed, making even more diﬃcult its identiﬁcation.

than 2% (1.8–4.5%), even for a sample collected in winter (SB7),
